data.title: Can't turn off both Fill and Expand flags of Control node
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows 10

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Can't turn off both `Fill` and `Expand` flags of Control node.
I can turn off both flags while editing and I got expected result.
But when running game, or close and reopen scene,
Size flag is reset to `Fill`.
And I can get expected result while running with `set_h_size_flags(0)` script.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. make a new Scene
2. add `Control` node
3. uncheck `Fill` size flag of Horizontal (and/or Vertical)
4. close scene
5. reopen scene
6. see the size flags is set to `Fill` again

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Timer doesn't have a pause like method
data.body:
Hello,
I'm trying to pause/resume timers running on my game for a stop time behavior.
https://gfycat.com/WickedBlueGreatdane
I successfully paused animations with the set_active(true)/set_active(false) and I was expecting the same for Timer, but I couldn't find anything similar.
So I request this feature.
If nobody mind I could give a try and implement it as a copy of the animation player behaviour.

data.title: Multiple editor plugins for same obj type
Mouse cursor set with Input.set_custom_mouse_cursor doesn't resize
data.body: stretch_mode is set to viewport, all sprites get smaller on window resize but the cursor stays the same causing a humongous cursor in my game

data.title: Added rotation/panning support for trackpads in 3D mode #53
data.body: Users can now rotate/pan/zoom based upon the key-bindings available in the settings even if they only have a trackpad. Closes #53

data.title: HTML5 export rendering oddity - clear color not working
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
HTML5 (exported from Linux 64-bit but using the pre-generated exports from the website)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The scene is a blue background with a 2D particle emitter and a few other sprites, the blue background on everything else is gray in html5, and the 2d particle emitter appears to be completely absent, but all other sprites work entirely.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Take the 2D Particle Demo, change the background clear color in the project settings->Render->default_clear_color to be something like blue or red or yellow or something obvious, then export to html5, then open it in Chrome.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Demo project from website.
I also changed the website demo project background clear color to red and exported it to html5, currently temporarily on my website at:  http://overminddl1.com/godot/particles_export.html
The altered project I can upload to if really wanted, but it is just the stock 2d particle project with the clear color changed to demonstrate both issues, the clear color is not used in the html5 export and the 2d particle systems do not work in the html5 export.

EDIT:  Actually I exported it again and particles are working here, but not the clear color, that is an odd change...  Well consider this as the clear color not exporting to html5 then...

data.title: GitHub login to Q&A site is broken when using www. subdomain
data.body:
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Can't login to http://godotengine.org/qa/ with GitHub - it shows a bland page with `You cannot access this page directly.` message.

The solution described here - http://www.question2answer.org/qa/49972/error-using-login-getting-error-cannot-access-directly-solve?show=49972#q49972 is just to reinstall open login module.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open http://godotengine.org/qa/
Click button in top right corner
Choose GitHub

data.title: Openssl generate sha and salt
data.body:
I am looking for a way to generate sha strings and rand_bytes (salt) to make my passwords safe.

Godot is already using openssl. Is it possible to support these functions?

data.title: Add "step" button next to "play"
data.body:
Feature proposal:
It would be nice to have a "step-by-step" button next to "play", to see the game execute frame by frame. It is useful when something happens too quickly, so we would be able to see it more precisely.

data.title: Add range 'for' with float step
data.body:
Tested on Windows 7 64 bits with Godot 2.0.1:

The following code produces an error:

``` gdscript
    for t in range(-PI, PI, PI/4.0):
        print(str(t))
```

"step argument is zero!"
Because range() seems to only accept integers, so because PI/4.0 is below 1, it interprets it as 0, and produces the error.

It would be nice to have float support in range too :)

data.title: intersect_shape crashes
data.body:
Windows 7 64 bits, Godot 2.0.1

The game crashes when I call space_state.intersect_shape with a CircleShape2D.
Example project: http://zylannprods.fr/dl/godot/IntersectShape.zip

EDIT:
The GDScript code was wrong, this works:

``` gdscript
    var space_state = get_world_2d().get_direct_space_state()
    var circle_shape = CircleShape2D.new()
    circle_shape.set_radius(16)
    var query = Physics2DShapeQueryParameters.new()
    query.set_shape(circle_shape)
    var hits = space_state.intersect_shape(query, 2)
```

It should have thrown a type error instead.

**EDIT2**
**There is another crash if I limit the reports to 1 while there are 2 shapes around.**
Repro in this project: http://zylannprods.fr/dl/godot/IntersectShape2.zip

data.title: SConstruct file ignores environment PKG_CONFIG_PATH
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
  Linux (NixOS)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Environment PKG_CONFIG_PATH is not inherited during environment creation in SConstruct.

Existing environment construction (line 67)

``` .python
env_base=Environment(tools=custom_tools, ENV = {'PATH' : os.environ['PATH']});
```

This creates a new environment ignoring everything in the operating system environment, apart from the path. 

It can be fixed by inheriting PKG_CONFIG_PATH from the environment

``` .python
env_base=Environment(tools=custom_tools, ENV = {
    'PATH' : os.environ['PATH'],
    'PKG_CONFIG_PATH' : os.environ['PKG_CONFIG_PATH']
});
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
run `scons platform=x11` with any dependency installed in a nonstandard location

data.title: Client StreamPeerTCP::get_status() returns STATUS_CONNECTED even after server close
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Win10 x64
Godot commit [15d1fca](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/15d1fca0614ad87fd16fa7532e4db867b342d00e) branch master

**Issue description**:
I'm checking if a client StreamPeerTCP connection is still alive in _process by checking its status but it seems that it doesn't know if server is shutdown because after I close the server, it still returns STATUS_CONNECTED. The server is netcat (Tried Hercules too) but the problem is from Godot and StreamPeerTCP::get_status()

**Link to minimal example project**:
[Client code](http://dpaste.com/2V7PYAJ)

data.title: doc/base/classes.xml: String.match, Node.find_node
data.body: Clarify wildcard behavior.

data.title: AnimationTreePlayer (_process_node): remove `switched` argument.
data.body:
The _process_node function (which recurses through the blend tree
generating blend values and the active animation list) had an argument
named `switched` which would loop an animation back to the beginning if
it had reached the end (regardless of whether or not it was supposed to
be a looping animation).

This argument was only used in four places: two of them were overridden
by a seek-to-zero, and I believe the other two are bugs.

In OneShot, it was used to reset the oneshot animation to the beginning
when fired. But this would fail if the oneshot node was fired before it
had completed its previous run. While this _could_ be a valid way for
oneshot to work (firing does nothing if it's already running), the code
currently resets the fade-in, so I believe that it is intended to reset.
I replaced this usage with seek-to-0.

In Transition, it was used on the previous (fading out) animation when
seeking the Transition node, which I believe is incorrect: why would you
want to loop a non-looping animation instead of simply fading out from
the end? Also it will never happen unless you seek the Transition node
twice during one cross-fade.

The other two uses are in Transition and _process_animation, where it is
used along with a seek-to-zero which overrides it.

data.title: AnimationPlayer Key+1 button on Sprite node is annoying
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Linux Mint 17.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I'm making an animation using multiple sprites at once, but when I want to key a "frame" I have to press the "Key+1" button, which keys the frame number but then increments it and moves 1 step in the animation player. So I have to move 1 step back every time I key a frame so that I could continue working on that step. This process gets a very annoying when using 5 separate sprites, and wastes a lot of time. An option to remove it in the editor settings (or just remove it in general) would be appreciated greatly.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
![selection_011](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4187882/14063372/4698d074-f39c-11e5-9b21-5ef366b875b1.png)

data.title: Improve 2D lights performance
data.body:
I use 2D lights a lot in my game, and noticed they impact FPS a lot (5 lights and more is enough), even with a tiny buffer (256).
Shadows projected by those lights don't change often, and most of them are static, so I expected a much lower FPS impact. 
Suggestions:
- Only update shadows when a change is really needed?
- Choice on the rendering technique? (is it a shader and a big quad? Or a shadow mesh like here http://www.redblobgames.com/articles/visibility/ ?)

My machine is a Window 7 64 bits, Godot 2.0.1, quad core i5, AMD radeon HD6670

data.title: Fixed numbers not highlighting after space
data.body: Fix for numbers not being highlighted after spaces, as mentioned [here.](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/4115)

data.title: Fix for issue #4118
data.body: Fix for issue #4118, it now saves the scene without capturing a thumbnail if in the script editor.

data.title: Adds support for aligned memory needed for SIMD code.
data.body:
Okay, this PR is actually adapted and updated from a stale fork by @rraallvv to be compatible with the latest revisions. This fork successfully implemented some working SIMD code for vectors and matricies. In order to make it work, and I can confirm this, these changes are required for Neon or SSE code work as SIMD code requires data to be 16-bit aligned. Without it, you will get random crashes. By default though, the actual alignment is disabled with macros, but what is intended to happen is that these macros should be activated when attempting to compile a build of the engine with SIMD support enabled.

I do actually have some experimental SIMD code ready, but it has yet to be given a fair performance comparsion and it could definetly use some cleaning up first, so that will likely be submitted as a seperate PR, but it will depend on merging this PR first.
